features.name: Bardic Inspiration
features.desc: Your words, musical pieces or dances are filled with so much talent, you can inspire others with it. It's a supernatural talent and your inspiration is represented by your bardic die

feature_data.name: Using bardic inspiration
feature_data.desc: You can take a bonus action to inspire anothe creature within a range of 60ft of you if they can see or hear you. This creature will receive one of your bardic dice, of which they can only have one at a time. When the inspired creature fails a d20 test within the next hour, they can roll the bardic dice and add the rolled value to their d20. the creature can do this once.

feature_data.name: Number of uses
feature_data.desc: You can use Bardic inspiration as many times as your CHA modifier and regain expended uses after a long rest.

feature_data.name: Higher levels
feature_data.desc: Your bardic die upgrades to a d8 at level 5, d10 at level 10 and a d12 at level 15

features.name: Spellcasting
features.desc: You know how to cast spells with your words, music or dances. You can use spells on the bard spell list

feature_data.name: Cantrips
feature_data.desc: You learn 2 cantrips of your choice from the bard spell list. This choice can be changed whenever you gain a character level.

feature_data.name: Spell slots
feature_data.desc: You have limited amounts of spell slots. See your bard's level class features to see how many you're allowed to have

feature_data.name: Prepared spells
feature_data.desc: You prepare a list of spells available to you. See your bard's level class features to see how many you're allowed to have prepared

feature_data.name: Replacing prepared spells
feature_data.desc: When your character level increases, you can change one spell of your spell list with another one with the correct spell slot

feature_data.name: Spellcasting ability
feature_data.desc: You use CHA as your spellcasting ability

feature_data.name: Spellcasting focus
feature_data.desc: you can use a musical instrument for spellcasting

features.name: Expertise
features.desc: You gain expertise in two of your skill proficiencies, which means you can double your proficiency bonus on checks for those skills

features.name: Jack of all trades
features.desc: You can add half your proficiency bonus to any ability checks that doesn't use your proficiency bonus
